page.title: 06MARKET RASEN-RELIGION
page.content: There are three main religious groups represented in the town. The Church of England has recently built a new Parish Rooms building adjacent to St. Thomas' church which was built in the 12th. century,but largely rebuilt in 1862.It occupies the site of a Norman church next to the Market Place in the centre of the town.The church also runs the Crusader Union meetings for youngsters (5-18).The Roman Catholic church,Holy Rood, is a 19th. century building set in beautiful wooded surroundings. This church has a large following and also provides instruction for the younger church members.The Methodist Chapel has a commanding situation with imposing columns. It was built in the 1880's next to the Railway Station. There is also a Salvation Army group,which is very active in the community.
